    Methods

    importFile

    • importFile(
          builder:
              | XernerxEventBuilder
              | XernerxMessageCommandBuilder
              | XernerxSlashCommandBuilder
              | XernerxContextCommandBuilder,
          filename?: string,
      ): Promise<
          | undefined
          | XernerxError
          | XernerxEventBuilder
          | XernerxMessageCommandBuilder
          | XernerxSlashCommandBuilder
          | XernerxContextCommandBuilder,
      >

      Imports a file by registering it with the client based on its type.

      Parameters

      • builder:
            | XernerxEventBuilder
            | XernerxMessageCommandBuilder
            | XernerxSlashCommandBuilder
            | XernerxContextCommandBuilder

        An instance of XernerxEventBuilder, XernerxMessageCommandBuilder, or XernerxSlashCommandBuilder. This object contains the necessary information to register the file with the client.

      • Optionalfilename: string

        An optional string representing the name of the file being imported. Used for error reporting if the builder ID is not unique.

      Returns Promise<
          | undefined
          | XernerxError
          | XernerxEventBuilder
          | XernerxMessageCommandBuilder
          | XernerxSlashCommandBuilder
          | XernerxContextCommandBuilder,
      >

      The builder object after it has been registered with the client. If the builder is of type XernerxEvent, it is registered as an event listener. If the builder is of type XernerxMessageCommand or XernerxSlashCommand, it is registered as a command.

      Inherited from Handler.importFile

      • Defined in src/handler/Handler.ts:79

    loadFile

    • loadFile(file: string): Promise<undefined | XernerxError>

      Asynchronously loads a JavaScript file and imports its default export.

      Parameters

      • file: string

        The path to the JavaScript file to be loaded.

      Returns Promise<undefined | XernerxError>

      A promise that resolves when the file is successfully loaded and imported. If the file does not have a default export, an error is thrown.

      Inherited from Handler.loadFile

      • Defined in src/handler/Handler.ts:48

    loadFiles

    • loadFiles(dir: string): string[]

      Loads JavaScript files from a specified directory.

      Parameters

      • dir: string

        The directory path from which to load the files.

      Returns string[]

      An array of file paths for JavaScript files in the specified directory. Returns an empty array if an error occurs during the file reading process.

      Inherited from Handler.loadFiles

      • Defined in src/handler/Handler.ts:28

    loadMessageCommand

    • loadMessageCommand(file: string): Promise<undefined | XernerxError>

      Loads a message command from a specified file.

      Parameters

      • file: string

        The path to the file containing the message command to be loaded.

      Returns Promise<undefined | XernerxError>

      A promise that resolves when the file has been successfully loaded.

      • Defined in src/handler/CommandHandler.ts:31

    loadMessageCommands

    • loadMessageCommands(options: XernerxMessageCommandHandlerOptions): Promise<void>

      Loads message commands based on the provided options.

      Parameters

      • options: XernerxMessageCommandHandlerOptions

        Configuration options for loading message commands, including directory, prefix, mention, separator, handleEdits, handleDeletions, and ignore settings.

      Returns Promise<void>

      A promise that resolves when all message commands have been successfully loaded.

      • Defined in src/handler/CommandHandler.ts:41

    loadSlashCommands

    • loadSlashCommands(options: XernerxSlashCommandHandlerOptions): Promise<void>

      Loads slash commands based on the provided options.

      Parameters

      • options: XernerxSlashCommandHandlerOptions

        Configuration options for loading slash commands, including the directory where the command files are located.

      Returns Promise<void>

      A promise that resolves when all slash commands have been successfully loaded.
